title: How to Dispose of Unwanted Latex Paint (Saw Dust Method)

steps.headline: Find a large box.
steps.description: E.g. 2 feet (0.6 m) by 1 1/2 feet (0.6 m) by 1 1/2 feet (0.6 m) deep.

steps.headline: Make sure the bottom has packing tape all around the edges on the bottom.
steps.description: Just in case you pour the paint a little too close to the corners.

steps.headline: Place about five to six inches of Sawdust in the box.
Here is the paint ready to go in.
Repeat as necessary or until the box gets too heavy.
steps.description: Remember how much a gallon of paint weighs.

steps.headline: Place box open in a cool dry place till it hardens.

text: Find a large box. E.g. 2 feet (0.6 m) by 1 1/2 feet (0.6 m) by 1 1/2 feet (0.6 m) deep. Make sure the bottom has packing tape all around the edges on the bottom. Just in case you pour the paint a little too close to the corners. Place about five to six inches of Sawdust in the box.  Here is the paint ready to go in.  Dump in the paint.  Stir it in.  Add more Sawdust.  More paint.  Stir it in.  Repeat as necessary or until the box gets too heavy. Remember how much a gallon of paint weighs. Place box open in a cool dry place till it hardens.
